task.title: How do I connect to the DITA repository on Webserve?
task.shortdesc: Connect to the DITA repository on Webserve by mapping the Siteshare folder to your workstation

taskbody.prereq:
You should have Oxygen XML Editor 12 (Windows, Mac) installed on your computer.
You must also be connected directly to the IU network or have a VPN connection.
taskbody.context:
The repository is organized into an Oxygen project. It is not necessary to use Oxygen to edit files but doing so provides two useful enhancements:
Validation via remote DTD files which are necessary to allow specialization without installing a plugin to the Open Toolkit
Shared templates and configuration settings

step.cmd: Follow the instructions on the Webmaster's Siteshare page to map a drive on your workstation to the worklist Webserve account: http://webmaster.iu.edu/tool_guide_info/siteshare/#use
In the mapped drive, browse to the following location: www/dita-prototypes.
Double-click the Oxygen project file, dita-kb.xpr, to open the project in Oxygen Editor.
